pli-tv-pvr1.10:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.10:0.4: The section on how many offenses
pli-tv-pvr1.10:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.1: (1) Because of having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offences does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.2: One commits four kinds of offenses?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.3: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.4: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.5: when one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:1.6: when one uses a dildo, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.1: (2) Because of stealing, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.3: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth five _māsaka_ coins or more than five _māsakas_, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.4: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth more than one _māsaka_ coin but less than five _māsakas_, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:2.5: when, intending to steal, one steals something worth one _māsaka_ coin or less than one _māsaka_, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.1: (3) Because of intentionally killing a human being, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.2: One commits three kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.3: when one digs a pit for people, thinking, “Falling into it someone will die,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.4: when the person experiences pain after falling in in, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:3.5: when the person dies, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.1: (4) Because of untruthfully and groundlessly boasting about a superhuman quality, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.3: when, having bad desires, overcome by desire, one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.4: when one says, “Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one,” and the listener understands, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:4.5: when the listener does not understand, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:5.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.1: (1) Because of emitting semen by means of effort, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.2: One commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.3: when one intends and makes an effort, and semen is emitted, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.4: when one intends and makes an effort, but semen is not emitted, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:6.5: the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.1: (2) Because of making physical contact with a woman, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.2: Because of making physical contact with a woman, one commits five kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.3: when a lustful nun consents to a lustful man taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.4: when a monk touches body with body, he commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.5: when one touches what is connected to the body with the body, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.6: when one touches what is connected to the body with what is connected to the body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:7.7: for tickling, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.1: (3) Because of speaking indecently to a woman, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.2: when, referring to the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.3: when, referring to any part below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, one praises and disparages, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:8.4: when, referring to anything connected to the body, one praises and disparages, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.1: (4) Because of commending the satisfaction of one’s own desires, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.2: when one encourages a woman to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.3: when one encourages a eunuch to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:9.4: when one encourages an animal to satisfy one’s own desires, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.1: (5) Because of acting as a matchmaker, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.2: when one accepts the mission, finds out the response, and reports back, one commits an offense entailing suspension;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.3: when one accepts the mission, and finds out the response, but does not report back, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:10.4: when one accepts the mission, but neither finds out the response, nor reports back, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.1: (6) Because of having a hut built by means of begging, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:11.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.1: (7) Because of having a large dwelling built, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.2: when one is having it made, the effort constitutes an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.3: when there is one piece left to complete the hut, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:12.4: when the last piece is finished, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.1: (8) Because of groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.2: when, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:13.3: when, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.1: (9) Because of charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, one commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.2: when, without having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:14.3: when, having obtained his permission, one speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.1: (10) Because of not stopping when pressed up to three times, a monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha commits three kinds of offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:15.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:16.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:17.2: after the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.1: Because of not giving up his course a monk who brings a family into disrepute, though being admonished up to three times falls into three offences:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.2: following the motion there is an offence of wrong-doing;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.3: following the two resolutions there is a grave offence;
pli-tv-pvr1.10:18.4: following the conclusion of the (three) resolutions there is an offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order. [13] …
pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.1: Because of, out of disrespect, easing oneself or spitting in water how many offences does one fall into?
pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.2: Because of, out of disrespect … one falls into one offence:
pli-tv-pvr1.10:19.4: Because of, out of disrespect … one falls into this one offence. [75]
pli-tv-pvr1.10:20.1: Concluded is the Second Chapter: on How Many Offences?
